page.title: 15Miserden Primary School
page.content: The school has been on its present site since{1914.}It has a{Church of {England foundation}and provides a primary education for boys and girls aged between{4 and 11. Up until 1984 there were three classes with about 65 children in the school. From then a reduction in available work in the area meant that families moved away. This resulted in a{two form school with a Headteacher {and a full time assistant teacher. Subjects provided include {reading,various aspects of writing, {religious education,mathematics and {studies of the world through {history,geography,science and {environmental work.}A varied curriculum of{music,games and drama are also provided. The day starts at 9.00 a.m and finishes at 3.30p.m with a break for lunch at midday.
